original: Evaṁ me sutaṁ—

translated: Thus have I heard.

original: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme
translated: On one occasion the Blessed One was dwelling at Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Park.

original: Tatra kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi:

translated: There the Blessed One addressed the bhikkhus thus:

original: “Bhadante”ti te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṁ.
analyzed: bhadanta iti te bhikkhū bhagavataḥ
translated: “Venerable sir!” those bhikkhus replied.

original: Bhagavā etadavoca:🔽“dhammaṁ vo, bhikkhave, desessāmi ādikalyāṇaṁ majjhekalyāṇaṁ pariyosānakalyāṇaṁ sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ, kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ pakāsessāmi, yadidaṁ—🔽cha chakkāni.
analyzed: bhagavān etat avoca  dhammam vaḥ bhikkhave desessāmi ādi kalyāṇam majjhe kalyāṇam pariyosāna kalyāṇam sa attham sa byañjana kevala paripuṇṇam parisuddham brahmacariyam pakāsessāmi yat idam  cha chakkāni
translated: The Blessed One said this:

original: Taṁ suṇātha, sādhukaṁ manasi karotha, bhāsissāmī”ti.
analyzed: tam suṇātha sādhukam manasi karotha bhāsissāmi iti
translated: “Bhikkhus, I will teach you a Dhamma discourse that is wholesome in the beginning, wholesome in the middle, and wholesome in the end, with the right meaning and phrasing, and which is entirely complete, pure, and noble. Listen and attend closely to what I shall say.”

original: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṁ.
analyzed: eva bhante iti kho te bhikkhū bhagavato
translated: “Yes, venerable sir,” the bhikkhus replied.

original: Bhagavā etadavoca:
analyzed: bhagavān etat avoca
translated: The Blessed One said this:

original: “Cha ajjhattikāni āyatanāni veditabbāni, cha bāhirāni āyatanāni veditabbāni, cha viññāṇakāyā veditabbā, cha phassakāyā veditabbā, cha vedanākāyā veditabbā, cha taṇhākāyā veditabbā.
analyzed: cha ajjhattikāni āyatanāni veditabbāni cha bāhirāni āyatanāni veditabbāni cha viññāṇa kāyā veditabbā cha phassa kāyā veditabbā cha vedanā kāyā veditabbā cha taṇhā kāyā veditabbā
translated: ‘The six inner sense-spheres should be known. The six outer sense-spheres should be known. The six classes of consciousness should be known. The six classes of contact should be known. The six classes of feeling should be known. The six classes of craving should be known.

original: ‘Cha ajjhattikāni āyatanāni veditabbānī’ti—
analyzed: cha ajjhattikāni āyatanāni veditabbāni iti
translated: ‘The six inner sense-spheres should be known.’

original: iti kho panetaṁ vuttaṁ. Kiñcetaṁ paṭicca vuttaṁ?
analyzed: iti kho pana itam vutta kiñca itam paṭicca vutta
translated: So it was said, and in reference to this was it said.

original: Cakkhāyatanaṁ, sotāyatanaṁ, ghānāyatanaṁ, jivhāyatanaṁ, kāyāyatanaṁ, manāyatanaṁ.
analyzed: cakkhāyatana sotāyatana ghānāyatana jivhāyatana kāyāyatana manāyatana
translated: The eye-sense-sphere, the ear-sense-sphere, the nose-sense-sphere, the tongue-sense-sphere, the body-sense-sphere, the mind-sense-sphere.

original: ‘Cha ajjhattikāni āyatanāni veditabbānī’ti—
analyzed: cha ajjhattikāni āyatanāni veditabbāni iti
translated: ‘The six inner sense-spheres should be known.’

original: iti yaṁ taṁ vuttaṁ, idametaṁ paṭicca vuttaṁ.🔽Idaṁ paṭhamaṁ chakkaṁ.
analyzed: iti yam tam vutta idam etam paṭicca vutta  idam paṭhamam chakka
translated: So it was said, and in reference to this was it said.🔽This is the first sixfold group.

original: ‘Cha bāhirāni āyatanāni veditabbānī’ti—
analyzed: cha bāhirāni āyatanāni veditabbāni iti
translated: ‘The six outer sense-spheres should be known.’

original: iti kho panetaṁ vuttaṁ. Kiñcetaṁ paṭicca vuttaṁ?
analyzed: iti kho pana itam vutta kiñca itam paṭicca vutta
translated: So it was said, and in reference to what was it said?

original: Rūpāyatanaṁ, saddāyatanaṁ, gandhāyatanaṁ, rasāyatanaṁ, phoṭṭhabbāyatanaṁ, dhammāyatanaṁ.
analyzed: rūpa āyatana sadda āyatana gandha āyatana rasa āyatana phoṭṭhabba āyatana dhamma āyatana
translated: The form-sense-sphere, the sound-sense-sphere, the smell-sense-sphere, the taste-sense-sphere, the tangiblesense-sphere, the idea-sense-sphere.

original: ‘Cha bāhirāni āyatanāni veditabbānī’ti—
analyzed: cha bāhirāni āyatanāni veditabbāni iti
translated: ‘The six outer sense-spheres should be known.’

original: iti yaṁ taṁ vuttaṁ, idametaṁ paṭicca vuttaṁ.
analyzed: iti yam tam vutta idam etam paṭicca vutta
translated: That’s why I said this.

original: Idaṁ dutiyaṁ chakkaṁ.
analyzed: idam dutiyam chakka
translated: This is the second six-fold group.

original: ‘Cha viññāṇakāyā veditabbā’ti—
analyzed: cha viññāṇa kāyāḥ veditabbā ati
translated: ‘The six classes of consciousness should be known.’

original: iti kho panetaṁ vuttaṁ. Kiñcetaṁ paṭicca vuttaṁ?
analyzed: iti kho pana itam vutta kiñca itam paṭicca vutta
translated: So it was said. And this is why it was said.

original: Cakkhuñca paṭicca rūpe ca uppajjati cakkhuviññāṇaṁ,🔽sotañca paṭicca sadde ca uppajjati sotaviññāṇaṁ,🔽ghānañca paṭicca gandhe ca uppajjati ghānaviññāṇaṁ,
analyzed: cakkhuñca paṭicca rūpe ca uppajjati cakkhu viññāṇa  sotam ca paṭicca sadde ca uppajjati sota viññāṇa  ghānam ca paṭicca gandhe ca uppajjati ghāna viññāṇa
translated: Eye consciousness arises dependent on the eye and sights.🔽Ear consciousness arises dependent on the ear and sounds.🔽Nose consciousness arises dependent on the nose and smells.

original: jivhañca paṭicca rase ca uppajjati jivhāviññāṇaṁ,
analyzed: jivhañca paṭicca rase ca uppajjati jivhā viññāṇa
translated: Tongue consciousness arises dependent on the tongue and tastes.

analyzed: kāyam ca paṭicca phoṭṭhabbe ca uppajjati kāya viññāṇa
translated: Body consciousness arises dependent on the body and touches.

analyzed: manam ca paṭicca dhamme ca uppajjati manas viññāṇa
translated: Mind consciousness arises dependent on the mind and thoughts.

original: ‘Cha viññāṇakāyā veditabbā’ti—
analyzed: cha viññāṇa kāyāḥ veditabbā ati
translated: ‘The six classes of consciousness should be known.’🔽That’s why I said this.

original: iti yaṁ taṁ vuttaṁ, idametaṁ paṭicca vuttaṁ.🔽Idaṁ tatiyaṁ chakkaṁ.
analyzed: iti yam tam vutta idam etam paṭicca vutta  idam tatiyam chakka
translated: This is the third six-fold group.

original: ‘Cha phassakāyā veditabbā’ti—

translated: ‘The six classes of contact should be known.’

analyzed: iti kho pana itam vutta kiñca itam paṭicca vutta
translated: So it was said. And this is why it was said.

translated: Eye consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and forms. The meeting of the three is contact.🔽Ear consciousness arises in dependence on the ear and sounds. The meeting of the three is contact.🔽Nose consciousness arises in dependence on the nose and smells. The meeting of the three is contact.

translated: Tongue consciousness arises in dependence on the tongue and tastes. The meeting of the three is contact.

translated: Body consciousness arises in dependence on the body and touches. The meeting of the three is contact.

translated: This is the fourth six-fold group.

translated: ‘The six classes of feeling should be known.’

analyzed: iti kho pana itam vutta kiñca itam paṭicca vutta
translated: So it was said. And this is why it was said.

original: Cakkhuñca paṭicca rūpe ca uppajjati cakkhuviññāṇaṁ, tiṇṇaṁ saṅgati phasso, phassapaccayā vedanā;🔽sotañca paṭicca sadde ca uppajjati sotaviññāṇaṁ, tiṇṇaṁ saṅgati phasso, phassapaccayā vedanā;🔽ghānañca paṭicca gandhe ca uppajjati ghānaviññāṇaṁ, tiṇṇaṁ saṅgati phasso, phassapaccayā vedanā;

With contact as a requisite condition there is feeling.

original: manañca paṭicca dhamme ca uppajjati manoviññāṇaṁ, tiṇṇaṁ saṅgati phasso, phassapaccayā vedanā.

translated: This is the fifth six-fold group.

translated: ‘The six classes of craving should be known.’

translated: So it was said. And this is the way to understand how it was said.🔽Dependent on the eye & forms there arises consciousness at the eye. The meeting of the three is contact. With contact as a requisite condition there is feeling. With feeling as a requisite condition there is craving.
